data.title: 49 Notable Alumni of the Technical University of Catalonia
data.meta_description: Below is the list of 49 notable alumni from the Technical University of Catalonia sorted by their wiki pages popularity. The directory includes famous graduates and former students along with research and academic staff.
data.meta_site_name: EduRank.org - Discover university rankings by location
data.text:
49 Notable alumni of

Technical University of Catalonia

Updated: February 29, 2024

EduRank

The Technical University of Catalonia is 1020th in the world, 355th in Europe, and 19th in Spain by aggregated alumni prominence. Below is the list of 49 notable alumni from the Technical University of Catalonia sorted by their wiki pages popularity. The directory includes famous graduates and former students along with research and academic staff.

Albert Espinosa

Born in

Spain

Years

1975-.. (age 49)

Occupations

writeractorjournalistfilm directorplaywright

Biography

Albert Espinosa i Puig, educated as an industrial engineer, is a Spanish screenwriter, playwright, writer, actor and director of cinema. He also works as a newspaper columnist at El Periódico de Catalunya.

Matthias Maurer

Born in

Germany

Years

1970-.. (age 54)

Occupations

materials scientistastronaut

Biography

Matthias Josef Maurer is a German ESA astronaut and Materials scientist, who was selected in 2015 to take part in space training.

Anna Kiesenhofer

Born in

Austria

Years

1991-.. (age 33)

Occupations

mathematiciansport cyclist

Biography

Anna Kiesenhofer is an Austrian professional cyclist and mathematician, who rides for UCI Women's Team Israel Premier Tech Roland. She is currently a postdoctoral fellow in mathematics at the École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL).

Roger Torrent i Ramió

Born in

Spain

Years

1979-.. (age 45)

Occupations

urban plannerpoliticianpolitical scientist

Biography

Roger Torrent i Ramió is a Spanish politician and urban planner from Catalonia. A former mayor of the municipality of Sarrià de Ter in north-eastern Spain, Torrent was President of the Parliament of Catalonia from January 2018 until March 2021. Since 26 May 2021 he is the Minister of Business and Work of Catalonia.

Jorge Fernández Díaz

Born in

Spain

Years

1950-.. (age 74)

Occupations

labour inspectorpoliticianindustrial engineer

Biography

Jorge Fernández Díaz is a Spanish politician and a member of the Partido Popular (PP).

Josep Puig i Cadafalch

Born in

Spain

Years

1867-1956 (aged 89)

Occupations

architectart historianpoliticianprofessor

Biography

Josep Puig i Cadafalch was a Spanish Modernista architect who designed many significant buildings in Barcelona, and a politician who had a significant role in the development of Catalan institutions. He was the architect of the Casa Martí (also known as "Els Quatre Gats"), which became a place of ideas, projects and social gatherings for such well-known Catalans as Santiago Rusiñol and Ramon Casas.

Carles Riera i Albert

Born in

Spain

Years

1960-.. (age 64)

Occupations

university teachersociologistsocial activisthead teacherhigh school teacher

Biography

Carles Riera i Albert is a Catalan sociologist and politician.

Olga Malinkiewicz

Born in

Poland

Years

1982-.. (age 42)

Enrolled in the Technical University of Catalonia

Studied in 2010

Occupations

physicist

Biography

Olga Malinkiewicz is a Polish physicist, inventor of a method of producing solar cells based on perovskites using inkjet printing. She is a co-founder and the Chief Technology Officer at Saule Technologies.

Juan Antonio Samaranch Salisachs

Born in

Spain

Years

1959-.. (age 65)

Occupations

engineerentrepreneur

Biography

Juan Antonio Samaranch Salisachs is a Spanish sports executive and financial analyst who currently serves as the vice president of the International Olympic Committee (IOC). He is the son of former IOC president Juan Antonio Samaranch.

Emma Roca Rodríguez

Born in

Spain

Years

1973-2021 (aged 48)

Enrolled in the Technical University of Catalonia

In 2019 graduated with doctorate in biochemistry

Occupations

ski mountaineerrunnerbusinesspersonresearcherathletics competitor

Biography

Emma Roca Rodríguez was a Spanish Catalan ski mountaineer and an eco-challenge member. She represented Spain which she was a captain, she helped her team to get in the top 10 spot.

Joan Rosell

Born in

Spain

Years

1957-.. (age 67)

Occupations

engineerbusinessperson

Biography

Joan Rosell Lastortras is the president of the Spanish employers confederation. He replaced Gerardo Diaz Ferran in June 2011. Prior to being elected to this post he was the president of the Catalan national employers federation (Foment del Treball Nacional) for 16 years. During his career he was president of the following companies; Congost, Enher, Fuerzas Eléctricas de Cataluña and OMB, Sistemas de Higiene Urbana.

Pere Navarro Olivella

Born in

Spain

Years

1952-.. (age 72)

Occupations

politicianindustrial engineer

Biography

Pere Navarro Olivella is a Spanish civil servant and politician who serves as Director-General for Traffic since June 2018. Navarro also served at this position from 2004 to 2012.

Carme Pinós

Born in

Spain

Years

1954-.. (age 70)

Occupations

architectproduct designer

Biography

Carme Pinós Desplat is a Spanish architect.

Ferran Latorre i Torres

Born in

Spain

Years

1970-.. (age 54)

Occupations

mountaineer

Biography

Ferran Latorre Torres is a Spanish mountaineer and adventurer.

Wifredo Ricart

Born in

Spain

Years

1897-1974 (aged 77)

Occupations

businesspersonengineerscientist

Biography

Wifredo Pelayo Ricart Medina was a Spanish engineer, designer and executive manager in the automotive industry, who spent his professional career in Spain and Italy.

Francisco Reynés

Born in

Spain

Years

1963-.. (age 61)

Occupations

international forum participantbusinessperson

Biography

Francisco Reynés Massanet, is a Spanish businessman and the current Executive Chairman of Naturgy (formerly Gas Natural Fenosa). Prior to this, he was CEO of Abertis Group, a role he held from 2010.

Damià Calvet i Valera

Born in

Spain

Years

1968-.. (age 56)

Occupations

technical architectpolitician

Biography

Damià Calvet i Valera is a Spanish politician from Catalonia and the current Minister of Territory and Sustainability.

Carme Pigem

Born in

Spain

Years

1962-.. (age 62)

Occupations

architect

Biography

Carme Pigem Barceló is a Spanish architect, a member of the Pritzker Prize-winning architectural firm RCR Arquitectes, together with Ramón Vilalta and Rafael Aranda.

Felip Puig Godes

Born in

Spain

Years

1958-.. (age 66)

Occupations

politicianengineer

Biography

Felip Puig Godes is a counselor for Enterprise and Employment who served in the past as the interior counselor of the region of Catalonia in Spain from 2010 to 2012. Previously, he had been environment counselor (1999–2001) and public works counselor (2001–2003). From 2002 to 2003 he also held the post of the regional government's spokesman. Earlier positions in the regional government include secretary general of the Welfare Counseling Office and chairman and managing director of ADIGSA, a former public corporation managing public housing.

Xavier Vendrell i Segura

Born in

Spain

Years

1966-.. (age 58)

Occupations

politicianbusinessperson

Biography

Xavier Vendrell i Segura is a Spanish entrepreneur. He presides over the Colombo-Catalan Chamber of Commerce and serves as chief executive officer of Barcelona Export Group and Biomek Group. He is a social democrat politician, and spent more than twenty years dedicated to politics on the Esquerra Republicana de Catalunya party. After politics he focused on business.

Joaquim Molins Amat

Born in

Spain

Years

1945-2017 (aged 72)

Occupations

politicianbusinesspersonindustrial engineer

Biography

Joaquim Molins i Amat was a Spanish politician who was a member of the Congress of Deputies and the Parliament of Catalonia. He died on 13 July 2017 of complications from pancreatic cancer.

Joan Busquets

Born in

Spain

Years

1946-.. (age 78)

Occupations

urban planneruniversity teacherarchitect

Biography

Joan Busquets i Grau is a Spanish architect, urban planner, and educator. Busquets is the Martin Bucksbaum Professor in Practice of Urban Planning and Design at the Harvard University Graduate School of Design. He is founder of the architecture firm, BAU Barcelona. Busquets was awarded the 2011 Erasmus Prize, an annual award for exceptional contributions to European culture and society, "...in appreciation of his impressive and multifaceted oeuvre in the field of city planning."

Mateo Valero Cortés

Born in

Spain

Years

1952-.. (age 72)

Enrolled in the Technical University of Catalonia

Graduated with doctorate

Occupations

computer scientistuniversity teachertelecommunications engineer

Biography

Mateo Valero Cortés is a Spanish computer architect. His research encompasses different concepts within the field of computer architecture, a discipline in which he has published more than 700 papers in journals, conference proceedings and books. Valero has received numerous awards, including the Eckert–Mauchly Award in 2007, for "extraordinary leadership in building a world class computer architecture research center, for seminal contributions in the areas of vector computing and multithreading, and for pioneering basic new approaches to instruction-level parallelism." He is the director of the Barcelona Supercomputing Center, which hosts the MareNostrum supercomputer.

Carles Buïgas

Born in

Spain

Years

1898-1979 (aged 81)

Occupations

writerengineerarchitect

Biography

Carles Buïgas i Sans was a Catalan architect, engineer, inventor and author.

Esteban Terradas Illa

Born in

Spain

Years

1883-1950 (aged 67)

Occupations

mathematicianprofessorphysicistphotographercivil engineer

Biography

Esteban Terrades i Illa also known as Esteve Terradas, was a Spanish mathematician, scientist and engineer. He researched and taught widely in the fields of mathematics and the physical sciences, working not only in his native Catalonia, but also in the rest of Spain and in South America. He was also active as a consultant in the Spanish aeronautics, electric power, telephone and railway industries.

Bernat Solé i Barril

Born in

Spain

Years

1975-.. (age 49)

Occupations

industrial engineerbasketball playerpoliticianteacher

Biography

Bernat Solé i Barril is a Spanish industrial engineer and politician from Catalonia, member of the Parliament of Catalonia and Minister of Foreign Action, Institutional Relations and Transparency of Catalonia between 2020 and 2021. He was previously mayor of Agramunt. He is currently awaiting trial on charges of disobedience for his role in the Catalan declaration of independence.

Álex Figueroa

Born in

Chile

Years

1961-2018 (aged 57)

Enrolled in the Technical University of Catalonia

Graduated with master's degree

Occupations

physicianpolitician

Biography

Álex Adolfo Figueroa Muñoz was a Chilean politician and physician who served as Minister of Health (1996–2000).

Xavier Ros-Oton

Born in

Spain

Years

1988-.. (age 36)

Occupations

mathematician

Biography

Xavier Ros Oton is a Spanish mathematician who works on partial differential equations (PDEs). He is an ICREA Research Professor and a Full Professor at the University of Barcelona.

Jordi Portabella

Born in

Spain

Years

1961-.. (age 63)

Occupations

politicianchief officer

Biography

Jordi Portabella was a member of the Catalan Parliament (1992-1999) and president of ERC in the City Hall of Barcelona (1999-2015), Nowadays is the CEO of Catalan Foundation of Research and Innovation.

Anna Bofill Leví

Born in

Spain

Years

1944-.. (age 80)

Occupations

pianistcomposerarchitect

Biography

Anna Bofill Leví is a Catalan Spanish pianist, architect and composer.

Elvira Dyangani Ose

Born in

Spain

Years

1974-.. (age 50)

Occupations

exhibition curatorcurator

Biography

Elvira Dyangani Ose is a Spanish art curator who has been serving as the director of MACBA Contemporary Art Museum in Barcelona.

Josep Acebillo

Born in

Spain

Years

1946-.. (age 78)

Enrolled in the Technical University of Catalonia

Graduated with licenciado in architecture

Occupations

architect

Biography

Josep Acebillo is a Spanish architect and is currently Research Professor at the University Pompeu Fabra in Barcelona. He obtained his Architecture degree from the Polytechnic University of Catalonia (ETSAB-1974).

Àngel Simón Grimaldos

Born in

Spain

Years

1957-.. (age 67)

Occupations

businessperson

Biography

Ángel Simón Grimaldos is a Spanish businessman, the executive president of Grupo Agbar since 2010.

Antonio Llardén

Born in

Spain

Years

1951-.. (age 73)

Occupations

businessperson

Biography

Antonio Llardén Carratalá is Executive Chairman of Enagás, the main carrier of natural gas in Spain and the Technical Manager of the Spanish Gas System. The company has presence in México, Chile and Perú, and participates in the European project Trans Adriatic Pipeline. It is also certified as independent TSO European Union, which homologates the company to gas transmission network operators of other European countries.

Rafael Termes

Born in

Spain

Years

1918-2005 (aged 87)

Occupations

economistbusinessperson

Biography

Dr. Rafael Termes i Carreró was a Spanish banker, economist and financial author born in Sitges, Barcelona. Although he graduated as an Industrial Engineer, he chose a career in finance and banking.

Antoni Subirà Claus

Born in

Spain

Years

1940-2018 (aged 78)

Occupations

university teacherpoliticianengineer

Biography

Antoni Subirà was a Spanish politician who was a member of Parliament of Catalonia (1980–1993) and co-founder of Democratic Convergence of Catalonia.

Joan Majó i Cruzate

Born in

Spain

Years

1939-.. (age 85)

Occupations

businesspersonengineerpoliticianentrepreneur

Biography

Joan Majó i Cruzate is a Spanish politician who served as minister of industry and energy from July 1985 to July 1986.

Georgina Oliva

Born in

Spain

Years

1990-.. (age 34)

Occupations

field hockey player

Biography

Georgina Oliva Isern is a Spanish field hockey midfielder who competed at the 2008 and 2016 Summer Olympics. She was included to the national team in 2006, and in 2015 named Best Player at the Valencia semifinal of the 2014/15 World League and Best Player in the Spanish Division de Honor. Individual award: Player of the Tournament in 2019 Women's EuroHockey Nations Championship

Ricardo Garcia Vilanova

Born in

Spain

Years

1971-.. (age 53)

Occupations

photojournalist

Biography

Ricardo Garcia Vilanova is a freelance Catalan photojournalist and videojournalist, specialized in conflict zones and humanitarian crises. He has reported on the Arab Spring and ISIS conflicts. He has published his work for journals and magazines like Life, Newsweek, Time, The New York Times, The Washington Post, The Wall Street Journal, Le Monde, Liberation, Paris Match, The Guardian, The Times, Die Welt, Der Spiegel, Stern, and many more. As a freelance video journalist, he has worked with CNN, BBC, Aljazeera, Channel 4, VICE, PBS, and Euronews, among others.

Francesc Torres

Born in

Spain

Years

1962-.. (age 62)

Enrolled in the Technical University of Catalonia

Graduated with doctorate

Graduated with telecommunications engineering degree

Occupations

university teachertelecommunications engineer

Biography

Francesc Torres Torres, also known as Xicu Torres, is a telecommunications engineer. He was elected rector of the Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya (UPC) in December 2017.

Laura Tremosa

Born in

Spain

Years

1937-.. (age 87)

Enrolled in the Technical University of Catalonia

In 1960 graduated with industrial engineering

Occupations

engineer

Biography

Laura Tremosa Bonavia is a Spanish industrial engineer and feminist. She studied mechanical engineering at the Polytechnic University of Catalonia in Barcelona, and earned her doctorate in the same field at the UPC in 1964. She was the first Catalan woman, and the second Spanish woman who qualified in industrial engineering.

Xavier Vilalta

Born in

Spain

Years

Enrolled in the Technical University of Catalonia

1998-2003 graduated with master's degree in architecture

Occupations

architect

Biography

Xavier Vilalta is a Spanish architect and professor. He studied architecture in Barcelona, London, and the Illinois Institute of Technology in Chicago.

Lluis Torner i Sabata

Born in

Spain

Years

1961-.. (age 63)

Occupations

physicist

Biography

Lluis Torner i Sabata is a physicist. He founded and leads ICFO. in Barcelona, Catalonia (Spain). He is the recipient of the 2016 National Research prize of Catalonia and of the 2017 Nature mentorship award.

Biography

Jesse Keyes is an American design entrepreneur. He developed One 7th Avenue South and created and co-owns the restaurant Hotel Griffou and the fashion label Karolina Zmarlak.

Joan Comas Pausas

Spain

Years

1913-2009 (aged 96)

Biography

Joan Comas Pausas was a Spanish painter, menswear trader and technical architect.

Marta Camps

Spain

academic

Biography

Marta Camps-Arbestain, usually known as Marta Camps, is a New Zealand soil science academic, and a full professor at Massey University.
